info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:40PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rio Blanco County through 515 PM MDT... At 440 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Rangely, or 53 miles southeast of Vernal, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rangely. This includes the following highways... Colorado 64 between mile markers 19 and 25, and between mile markers 31 and 33. Colorado 139 between mile markers 51 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Moderate to heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
